alert.note: Alert for Allegan; Van Buren (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 28 at 11:24PM EDT until August 30 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...High wave action, strong currents, and dangerous swimming conditions expected. Piers may be heavily swamped by waves. * WHERE...Allegan and Van Buren counties. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Strong currents can pull swimmers into deeper water and high waves can sweep people off piers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...North winds increasing in the afternoon and evening will produce dangerous swimming conditions late in the day and especially towards evening. North sides of north piers will become especially dangerous towards sunset. North Beach at South Haven will be a particularily dangerous beach.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions and do not venture out on piers. Please check with your local authorities on potential beach closures.
